question: An accident is an unexpected or unplanned event that causes ________ or injury.
Accidents can happen anywhere, such as at ________, on the road, or in industries.
In industrial settings, accidents are unwanted events that cause ________ or production loss.
A worker in a factory slips on a wet floor and falls, which is an example of a ________ accident.
A machine operator gets his hand caught in a moving machine part, which is an example of a ________ accident.
Industrial accidents can be classified into different types, including ________ accidents.
Mechanical accidents occur due to ________ or equipment failure.
A worker’s hand gets caught in a machine’s moving parts, which is an example of a ________ accident.
Electrical accidents happen due to ________ wiring, electric shocks, or equipment failure.
An electrician gets an electric shock while repairing a circuit, which is an example of an ________ accident.
Fire and explosion accidents occur due to ________ materials, gas leaks, or unsafe handling of chemicals.
A gas cylinder explodes in a welding workshop, which is an example of a ________ accident.
Chemical accidents occur when hazardous chemicals cause ________ or poisoning.
A worker inhales toxic fumes from a chemical spill, which is an example of a ________ accident.
Slips, trips, and falls accidents happen when workers fall due to ________ surfaces or obstacles.
A worker slips on an oily floor and breaks his leg, which is an example of a ________ accident.
Falling objects accidents are caused by objects falling from ________.
A brick falls from a building under construction and injures a worker, which is an example of a ________ accident.
Confined space accidents occur when workers are trapped in small spaces with low ________ levels.
A worker suffocates while working in a storage tank, which is an example of a ________ accident.
Causes of industrial accidents can be classified into three main categories: human, mechanical, and ________ causes.
Human causes of accidents occur due to workers' ________ or lack of training.
Not wearing safety gear is an example of a ________ cause of an accident.
Mechanical causes of accidents are due to ________ equipment or machinery failure.
A machine suddenly stops working and injures a worker, which is an example of a ________ cause of an accident.
Environmental causes of accidents are due to ________ workplace conditions.
Poor lighting is an example of an ________ cause of an accident.
Slippery floors causing workers to fall is an example of an ________ cause of an accident.
Excessive noise leading to hearing problems is an example of an ________ cause of an accident.
Industrial accidents are unpredictable but ________ with proper safety measures.
Companies should provide safety training and maintain machines properly to reduce ________.
Following safety rules helps in preventing ________ and ensuring a safe work environment.
An accident is defined as an unexpected event that causes ________ or damage.
Accidents can occur in various settings, including at ________, on the road, or in industries.
In industrial settings, accidents are unwanted events that result in ________ or production loss.
A worker slipping on a wet floor is an example of a ________ accident.
A machine operator getting his hand caught is an example of a ________ accident.
Industrial accidents can be categorized into different types, including ________ accidents.
Mechanical accidents occur due to ________ or equipment failure.
A worker’s hand getting caught in a machine is an example of a ________ accident.
Electrical accidents happen due to ________ wiring or equipment failure.
An electrician getting an electric shock is an example of an ________ accident.
Fire and explosion accidents occur due to ________ materials or gas leaks.
A gas cylinder explosion is an example of a ________ accident.
Chemical accidents occur when hazardous chemicals cause ________ or poisoning.
A worker inhaling toxic fumes is an example of a ________ accident.
Slips, trips, and falls accidents happen when workers fall due to ________ surfaces or obstacles.
A worker slipping on an oily floor is an example of a ________ accident.
Falling objects accidents are caused by objects falling from ________.
A brick falling from a building is an example of a ________ accident.
